Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE DATE: The date when the facility was first active.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CONSTRUCTED DATE: the date when construction of the facility was completed.
Column Comment.6: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.7: CURRENT STATUS DATE: Date of the current status for the facility.
Column Comment.8: DESCRIPTION; a description of the facility.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: FACILITY NAME: Name assigned to the facility. This may be the legal or registeredname as it appears on a permit or a given name assigned by the operator.
Column Comment.12: FACILITY SHORT NAME: Common short name used for the facility.
Column Comment.13: FACILITY STATUS: The operational state of the facility.
Column Comment.14: INACTIVE DATE: the date when the facility became inactive or was no longer in use.
Column Comment.15: LAST INJECTION DATE: The date that injection volumes were last reported for thisentity.
Column Comment.16: LAST PRODUCTION DATE: The date that production was last reported for thisentity.
Column Comment.17: LAST REPORTED DATE: The date that a production report was last submitted forthis entity.
Column Comment.18: LATITUDE: Latitude of the facility location.
Column Comment.19: LONGITUDE: Longitude of the facility location.
Column Comment.20: ON INJECTION DATE: The date that injection was first reported for this entity.
Column Comment.21: ON PRODUCTION DATE: The date that production was first reported for this entity.
Column Comment.22: PLOT NAME: Name alias used when plotting the facility on a map.
Column Comment.23: PLOT SYMBOL: A character or symbol used to represent a facility. This may be usedin a particular mapping package coding scheme, or as a pointer to other applicationdependent files.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: FACILITY STATUS TYPE: A list of the types of status that may be tracked for afacility, such as construction, production, reclamation, operational, flaring etc.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
